title: Adds search tie-in to global search
message:
Adds search tie-in to global search

This integrates SimpleContentProvider's new search feature. This allows
DFS to be searched in the system Quick Search box. This can be turned on
by going to your phone's search, settings, and then looking for Dear
Future Self.

title: Adds first pass at a search feature
message:
Adds first pass at a search feature

Currently only supports basic full text search (not using the FTS
sqlite feature). Currently doesn't limit to messages from inbox.

title: Improves MessageList activity's handling of new URIs

Improves MessageList activity's handling of new URIs

Prevents progress spinner from popping up if it is going to go away
immediately.

Upgrades SimpleContentProvider to new revision and uses new DefaultSort
annotation.

title: Reschedules all in transit messages to be displayed on first load
message:
Reschedules all in transit messages to be displayed on first load

If a message was created, but not delivered and if the app was
reinstalled, the message would never be delivered until the device
reboots. Now the app reschedules pending alarms when the main activity
opens.

title: TimelineEntry: Adds content description for accessibility
message:
TimelineEntry: Adds content description for accessibility

Unfortunately, the widget is not yet accessible, as there is no
directional input nor focusability.

title: TimelineEntry: moves touch tracking to GestureDetector
message:
TimelineEntry: moves touch tracking to GestureDetector

In order to better support multiple DPIs as well as to be able to detect
taps and such, this gets rid of the custom finger tracking in order to
detect fling / scroll gestures. Unfortunately, this also gets rid of
pinch to zoom in/out, but it was never working flawlessly anyhow.

title: Fixes the year 2038 bug + locale formatting in date display
message:
Fixes the year 2038 bug + locale formatting in date display

DateUtils has a jumble of date routines that use different techniques
for formatting dates. One of them uses a native time library that is
only 32 bit.

see: http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=13050

This patches it by using DateFormat instead. This seems like a good
solution, which may work for Android itself as well.

title: Adds hacked version of DateUtils that fixes presentation bug
message:
Adds hacked version of DateUtils that fixes presentation bug

This is the same fix that was introduced in Android codebase
ca3363775e03e0f90bdf111d3e5c54b3ab16df57

Where relative time in the future was presented incorrectly when it
happened to be the same week day as it currently is.

title: Improves Import/export
message:
Improves Import/export

Export now inspects the database structure in order to determine what
types to serialize to. This fixes an encoding error where longs were
getting represented in scientific notation and integers were strings.

title: Improves notification, list view, editing; adds deletion
message:
Improves notification, list view, editing; adds deletion

This improves notifications by showing the number of unread messages as
well bringing the user to the main list if there are more than one
unread messages. This also improves the message list view.

Adds a shared text parser to better format text shared by applications,
such as Twitter.
